metadata.titel_preek: Eighth Sunday After the Epiphany / Baptism of the Lord

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God interrupts human mundane/sinful existence with His terrifying presence to bestow a new identity and mission through grace.

subject.identificatie: God (YHWH / Jesus / The Angel of the Lord)
tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
God will interrupt the normal progression of things by arriving in—indeed, invading—the midst of human events
He puts redemption into our blanket
the awareness of sin comes only to those who are already standing on the firm ground of their salvation

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Holy One of Israel
tekstueel_bewijs: the God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (represented by Gideon, Peter, and the Exile)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus stoops down to us in our miserable condition
the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all
paying in his own body the price of sin

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin and Human Resistance (Selfishness, Greed, Idolatry)
tekstueel_bewijs: God is opposed to our selfishness, greed, idolatry...
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that would cause us to be 'lost' if allowed to play out to the end; it requires a divine 'invasion' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of following and serving after being 'fear-noted'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Peter/Gideon)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The mission (Secondary) only occurs after the 'irruption of grace' (Primary) has established the Subject's competence.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will interrupt the normal progression
He puts redemption into our blanket
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The young woman is eager to prove

voorbeelden: keep the covenant they have made
the awareness of sin comes only to those...
power to make our resistance go up in flames
sphere of power capable of calling into existence

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to act where humans are incompetent. Grace is the endowment of power to the powerless.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Mundane (~S1) to Terror (S2) to the Resolution of Grace (S1) via the 'Fear Not' (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's presence being both the source of terror (holiness) and the source of peace (mercy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; terror is described as 'plain terror or dread'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject who initiates, interrupts, and bestows without human prerequisite.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We can understand and even admire the hope, however forlorn, for something better.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He does not ask us what we are doing to make ourselves better; he just gives the gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon and Peter are used as types of the 'Receiver' of grace, not as moral examples to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God acts upon them.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; shift from self-reliance to reliance on the 'irruption of grace'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; grace precedes awareness of sin.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'terrifying God' of the OT to the 'stooping Christ' of the NT is structurally seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'fear' and 'peace' is maintained rather than collapsed.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is 'rebelliousness' that leads to being 'lost'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a Grace-oriented actantial structure where God is the Subject and man is the Receiver.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current identification with the 'sleeping addict' receiving the gift.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain; this is appropriate for Epiphany/Baptism themes.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Secondary Program' (the 'following') is clearly linked as a fruit of the gift.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) clearly precedes and enables Ethics (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful homiletical structure that avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' and keeps the focus on the Divine Actant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'funny' Gideon anecdote, semiotics reveals Gideon's role as a 'non-competent Subject' waiting for God's endowment.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of 'fear' to show how 'fear' functions as a narrative marker of the Subject's encounter with the Holy.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'blanket' metaphor is a perfect semiotic representation of the 'Receiver' actant—passive and unconscious of the gift's arrival.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace' effectively by making God the subject of the most significant verbs (save, give, interrupt, love).
